business.headline: Indian banking sector shows stability, bad loans fall to multi-decade low: ReportIndia's banking sector has shown resilience in 2025, with strong growth, improved asset quality, and attention to emerging climate risks, according to a recent Reserve Bank of India report.

India's crude oil imports rise in December as Delhi continues buying from MoscowIndia's Russian oil imports are poised to top 1 million barrels per day in December, defying expectations for a sharp decline as refiners have resumed buying from non-sanctioned entities offering deep discounts.

China to cut import tariffs on key commodities and medical supplies in 2026: ReportChina has announced cutting duties on key resource-based materials, including recycled black powder used in lithium-ion batteries.

The uncomfortable truth behind silver's spectacular rallySilver's rise is increasingly being driven not by sentiment or speculation, but by a deep and persistent shortage of physical metal. And that shortage is now reshaping how the market works.

8th Pay Commission: Check key expectations on salary hike, DA, and arrearsWith the 8th Pay Commission set to kick in from January 1, 2026, central government employees and pensioners are keen to know how much their salaries may rise, what could change in Dearness Allowance, and when arrears might be paid.
Sensex ends 346 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Tata Steel up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 345.91 points to end at 84,695.54, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 100.20 points to close at 25,942.10.

Unacademy ESOP move explained: Legal, ethical, or unfair to employees?Over time, ESOPs have become a key pillar of startup compensation in India. However, Unacademy's recent decision to sharply reduce the ESOP exercise window for former employees has forced many to reassess how secure and attractive these options really are.

Hindustan Zinc share price falls 3% after hitting 16-month high. What's next?The stock moved lower later in the session after a strong rally seen over the past few weeks and was trading at Rs 622.80, down 2.21% as of 1:41 PM.

Why withdrawing EPF during a job switch can be a costly financial mistakeFor many salaried Indians, a job switch is exciting but also financially unsettling. Between rent deposits, moving costs and lifestyle adjustments, the temptation to dip into accumulated EPF savings is very real.

Is there any penalty if you file a revised ITR before December 31 deadline?Found an error in your tax return and unsure what to do next? Is there any penalty if you correct it by filing a revised ITR before December 31?

Timex Group shares crash over 10% today. Know why it's fallingAt around 12 pm, shares of Timex Group India were trading at Rs 316.60 on the BSE, down 9.99%. During the day, the stock touched an intra-day low of Rs 318 per share.

Gold prices at record highs: What's driving the rally and what comes next?Gold's rally is not being driven by a single factor. Instead, multiple supportive forces are acting together. Here's all you need to know.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked yet? What happens if you miss December 31 deadlineIf your PAN is still not linked with Aadhaar, the clock is ticking. The Income Tax Department has set December 31, 2025 as the final deadline, and missing it could make your PAN inoperative, affecting tax filing and refunds.

Silver breaches Rs 2.5 lakh per kg for 1st time: Why waiting may be wiserThe sharp rise has put silver firmly in the spotlight, forcing investors to confront a familiar question at uncomfortable levels: is it still worth buying, or is patience the better strategy now?

Why experience-led design is becoming a core growth driver for hotelsToday, aesthetics, technology, sustainability, and emotional engagement intersect to shape both guest satisfaction and commercial growth.

IRFC share price down over 4% after recent rally: Why is it falling today?Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC) fell as much as 4.64% during the day to Rs 127.44 on the BSE. Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd declined up to 3.84% to Rs 373.05.
Hindustan Copper share price jumps over 11%: What's driving the rally?The Hindustan Copper stock was trading at Rs 528.55, up 11.13%, at around 11:24 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Silver prices at record high: Should you buy now or wait for correction?The takeaway from experts is fairly clear. Silver's long-term outlook remains strong, supported by rising industrial demand, tight supply, and its dual role as a precious and industrial metal.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher amid lack of fresh triggersThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 18.79 points to 85,060.24, while the NSE Nifty50 added 11.90 points to 26,054.20 as of 9:23 am.

Silver at record highs: Why prices are surging and should you buy now?Market experts say silver's sharp rise is being driven by a powerful combination of factors rather than a single trigger. Here is all you need to know.

entertainment.headline: Shilpa Rao talks about her journey in music industry: My eight songs didn't work Shilpa Rao opened up about the highs and lows of her playback singing career, stressing that success in music is unpredictable and never permanent.

Aamir Khan's daughter Ira on discomfort with body image, struggle with self-worth Ira Khan shared a video revealing her struggle with body image and food since 2020, admitting she felt obese for her age and height. She explained this issue interfered with her relationships, work, and overall self-worth, similar to her past depression.

Tara Sutaria breaks silence on viral concert video with AP Dhillon: Clever editing Tara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya have responded to online speculation around a viral clip from AP Dhillon's Mumbai concert, clarifying that Veer's reaction was taken out of context.

Kannada and Tamil TV actor Nandini CM dies by suicide in Bengaluru Kannada and Tamil television actor Nandini CM died by suicide at her Bengaluru residence. A death note reportedly mentioned pressure to marry and depression, while police continue to investigate the circumstances.

Jaideep Ahlawat in Drishyam 3? Director Abhishek Pathak sets record straight Director Abhishek Pathak and producer Kumar Mangat Pathak clarify Jaideep Ahlawat's casting in Drishyam 3 following Akshaye Khanna's departure. The film is set for an October 2026 release and faces a legal dispute with Khanna over his exit.

Arshad Warsi recalls early reactions to his interfaith marriage with Maria Goretti Arshad Warsi recalled the early days of his interfaith marriage with Maria Goretti, sharing how her Catholic parents were initially anxious but gradually accepted him with time and trust.

Salman Khan serves Bhel Puri to Riteish and Genelia on 60th birthday. Video Salman Khan served Bhel Puri to Riteish and Genelia Deshmukh at his Panvel farmhouse during his 60th birthday celebrations. Genelia shared the video on social media, praising Salman's hospitality.

Jagapathi Babu transforms into Appala Soori for Ram Charan's Peddi, first look out The makers of Ram Charan's upcoming film Peddi  released a new character poster introducing Jagapathi Babu in a heavily transformed role.

Prabhudheva unveils Moon Walk character posters, teases 14 crazy roles Prabhudheva unveiled six character posters for his upcoming film Moon Walk. The musical comedy reunites him with A.R. Rahman and promises a unique entertainer releasing in May 2026.

Exclusive: The Copenhagen Test's Simu Liu, Melissa Barrera are ready for Bollywood 'The Copenhagen Test' actors Simu Liu and Melissa Barrera discussed their hopes for more diverse representation in the entertainment industry and revealed a shared enthusiasm for working in Indian cinema. When invited to visit India, Liu expressed his desire to make a Bollywood film.

Avengers Doomsday to The Odyssey: Most anticipated 2026 Hollywood films in India Hollywood's 2026 calendar balances blockbuster spectacles and character-driven stories. Indian audiences can expect diverse films ranging from Nolan's The Odyssey to major superhero sequels.

Panchayat 5 to Taskaree: Series and films on OTT fans are waiting for in 2026 After a tough year of budget cuts and stalled projects, 2026 is set to be a comeback for India's OTT industry, with a slate of star-led films, returning favourites, and ambitious originals boosting scale and audience engagement.

Imran Khan on uncle Aamir Khan getting death threats for his show Satyamev Jayate Imran Khan recalled that Aamir Khan's talk show, 'Satyamev Jayate' depicted social issues and angered those involved in "evil practices," prompting death threats against the host. Imran revealed that his uncle was warned that if he spoke too much, people would come to his house and destroy it.

Ektaa Kapoor slams reuse of Pavitra Rishta title for new TV show: Terrible ethics Ektaa Kapoor has strongly criticised the makers of Zee TV's upcoming show Pavitra Rishta for reusing the iconic title of her original hit series.

Yami Gautam on admiring Dhurandhar: I wished I was a guy after reading the script Yami Gautam Dhar shared that after reading husband Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar script, she jokingly wished she were a man because of how powerful the role was. However, the actor made it clear that she never expects to be cast in her husband's films and keeps work and marriage strictly separate.

Allu Sirish announces wedding date with reel featuring Allu Arjun's kids. Watch Actor Allu Sirish has announced his wedding date in an unconventional and playful way, sharing a reel on social media that has quickly gone viral.

World of Parasakthi: Sivakarthikeyan, Ravi Mohan and team share stories Ahead of its January 2026 release, the team behind Parasakthi has unveiled a new video showcasing the film's scale, characters and creative process.

Dhurandhar: Danish Pandor on 15 years of struggle, Akshaye Khanna's on-set isolation Danish Pandor reflects on a hard-earned breakthrough with Dhurandhar, his years of unseen struggle, intense preparation, and the lessons learnt from watching Akshaye Khanna's almost meditative process on set.

After Drishyam 3 exit, director challenges Akshaye Khanna to do a solo film After news of Akshaye Khanna's exit from 'Drishyam 3' emerged online, director Abhishek Pathak shared Ajay Devgn's reaction to the move and even challenged the actor to attempt a solo film.

general news.headline: India hits back at Pak on minorities charge: Your abysmal record speaks for itselfIndia was responding to remarks by Pakistani Foreign Affairs spokesperson Tahir Andrabi, who had urged the international community to take note of what he alleged were incidents "targeting religious minorities" in India, including "Christmas-related vandalism and attacks on Muslims."

Stripped of dignity: Kuldeep Sengar's family alleges injustice, societal harassmentAishwarya Sengar said that during the Supreme Court hearing into the matter on Monday, arguments from her side were not heard. She alleged that there were several inconsistencies and discrepancies in the survivor's statements.

Feed chicken, make it elephant: Sadhguru calls Siliguri Corridor unrectified anomalyAmid threatening statements by Bangladeshi politicians on India's north-east and the narrow Siliguri Corridor, Sadhguru said the Chicken's Neck was an anomaly from 1947 that should have been rectified in 1971. In the 1971 war, India defeated Pakistan to help liberate Bangladesh.

Cancel work permit for Indians: Osman Hadi's outfit's ultimatum to Bangladesh govtThe radical group has pressed the Bangladesh government to complete the trial of everyone involved in the murder of Osman Hadi within 24 days and demanded that the work permit for Indians be suspended.

Tara Sutaria breaks silence on viral concert video with AP Dhillon: Clever editingTara Sutaria and Veer Pahariya have responded to online speculation around a viral clip from AP Dhillon's Mumbai concert, clarifying that Veer's reaction was taken out of context.

Kannada and Tamil TV actor Nandini CM dies by suicide in BengaluruKannada and Tamil television actor Nandini CM died by suicide at her Bengaluru residence. A death note reportedly mentioned pressure to marry and depression, while police continue to investigate the circumstances.

Dense fog disrupts air travel in north India: Airlines issue advisoriesThe airline cautioned that dense fog forecast for the early morning hours could lead to cascading disruptions across its network, particularly flights to and from Delhi.

Dispute over friend on Lanka honeymoon behind Bengaluru newly-weds' suicide?Just weeks into his marriage, Bengaluru man Suraj Shivanna drove nearly 1,000 km from home and killed himself after being accused of abetting the suicide of his wife, Ganavi. It has been alleged that the revelation of a pre-marital friendship during the couple's Sri Lanka honeymoon led to the trip being cut short and the couple's death, days apart.

I cut sugar for 30 days. Here's what it did to my bodyGiving up sugar for 30 days sounded simple, but it turned out to be tougher than expected. Here's what I noticed from cravings and mood changes to better energy and digestion.

After Thackerays, now Pawars: What drove big Maharashtra reunionsMaharashtra's most powerful political families, the Thackerays and Pawars, are suddenly back together after a bitter feud. Old bitterness has been set aside, alliances redrawn and familiar surnames reclaimed. The timing is no coincidence, raising the one question that matters: why now?

UPSC no longer relevant, says Sanjeev Sanyal in AI-era wake-up callSanjeev Sanyal, a member of the Prime Minister's Economic Advisory Council (EAC), has questioned the value of UPSC preparation, criticised traditional universities, and called for a shift toward skills, apprenticeships, and AI-ready education as the job market rapidly evolves.

China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan; 1 lakh air passengers affectedTaiwan reported dozens of Chinese aircraft and vessels near its 24-nautical-mile contiguous zone and condemned the manoeuvres as provocations that undermine regional peace. Taiwan's forces have been placed on high alert.

Video: Tamil Nadu boys attack migrant worker with machete, flash 'victory' signA video showing four minors brutally attacking a migrant worker in Tamil Nadu with machetes has gone viral, triggering outrage and prompting a police investigation.

Find everything your baby needs this holiday season on Amazon's Everyday EssentialsAs part of the New Year selections, the specially curated New Year Store —available until 31 December 2025—brings up to 50% off across a wide selection of everyday essentials.

How a Buddhist prince opened Kashmir's gates for Islamic ruleRecent excavations at Zehanpora in Baramulla have unearthed Kushan-era stupas along the ancient Silk Route, confirming Kashmir's role as a Buddhist hub of learning. But, the transition of Kashmir from a Hindu kingdom to Islamic rule is an equally fascinating story, written, ironically, by a Buddhist prince who came to the Valley as a refugee.

Two Telangana women, on job hunt in US, killed in road accidentThe victims were identified as Pullakhandam Meghana Rani and Kadiyala Bhavana, both aged 24. The two women were originally from Garla Mandal, Mahabubabad district.

Dhurandhar ka Chinese baap: Ne Zha 2 grosses Rs 18,000 crore!The biggest global hit of 2025 is Ne Zha 2, the Chinese animated film made on a budget LA studios would deem paltry. However, its screen count and collections bare the disparity between Indian and Chinese film trade.

Live: Protests continue as Inqilab Mancha presses demands over Osman Hadi killingNomination papers for Bangladesh's 13th general election were filed smoothly on Monday at the Dhaka Divisional Commissioner's Office, with the process going on smoothly until the 5 pm deadline, Returning Officer Sharaf Uddin Ahmed Chowdhury said. BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman has signed and submitted his nomination papers and will contest from the Dhaka-17 and Bogra-6 constituencies, according to party sources. His entry into the race comes amid political unrest marked by protests, violence and allegations of attacks on minorities. Separately, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi condemned recent lynching incidents, urging protection of Bangladesh's minorities and restraint in India-Bangladesh ties. Stay tuned to Indiatoday.in for live updates.

Pakistan rattled as India approves new project on Chenab amid Indus treaty pauseWith the Indus Waters Treaty on hold, the Centre has approved the 260-MW Dulhasti Stage-II hydropower project on the Chenab as part of its push to harness the full potential of the Indus River System. Though run-of-the-river projects remain permissible even under the now-suspended Indus treaty, that hasn't stopped Pakistan from accusing India of "weaponising water".

Anthony Joshua involved in car crash that leaves 2 dead in Nigeria: ReportAnthony Joshua was injured in a car crash on the Ogun–Lagos expressway in Nigeria that left two people dead. The local police reportedly said Joshua sustained minor injuries and is stable.
Alia Bhatt is in her bow phase and we are not complainingAlia Bhatt has taken over social media with her effortlessly chic festive looks, with her bow accessories stealing the spotlight.

Supreme Court pauses own order on definition of Aravalli Hills, sets up review panelThe Supreme Court said that the environmental impact of recommendations made by an earlier panel on the Aravalli range must be examined by a committee of experts, noting that the previous panel was largely composed of bureaucrats.

The uncomfortable truth behind silver's spectacular rallySilver's rise is increasingly being driven not by sentiment or speculation, but by a deep and persistent shortage of physical metal. And that shortage is now reshaping how the market works.
Aravalli formed 2.5 billion years ago, could vanish by 2059One of the world's oldest mountain systems that formed over 2.5 billion years ago, the Aravalli range, is on course to likely go extinct.

sports.headline: Why Ruben Amorim resisted changing his system early at Manchester United Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim said changing the club's formation in response to media pressure would have been "the end" for him, underlining the importance of sticking to his ideas despite intense scrutiny.

WPL: Mumbai Indians appoint Kristen Beams as spin-bowling coach Mumbai Indians have added former Australia leg-spinner Kristen Beams to their coaching setup as spin-bowling coach, strengthening the support staff ahead of their WPL 2026 title defence.

Sabalenka, Kyrgios defend 'Battle of the Sexes', see only positives from match Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios defended their controversial "Battle of the Sexes" match. Kyrgios called out the media for allegedly spreading negativity.

Anthony Joshua involved in car crash that leaves 2 dead in Nigeria: Report Anthony Joshua was injured in a car crash on the Ogun–Lagos expressway in Nigeria that left two people dead. The local police reportedly said Joshua sustained minor injuries and is stable.

FIFA president defends 2026 World Cup ticket pricing amid booming demand FIFA President Gianni Infantino defended the ticket prices for next year's World Cup in the United States, Canada and Mexico, pointing to overwhelming demand and the revenue the tournament generates for football around the world.

Rishabh Pant fails as Virat Kohli-less Delhi clinch crucial win vs Saurashtra Vijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli's absence did not affect Delhi on Monday, December 29, as they beat Saurashtra to win a key group-stage game. Captain Rishabh Pant failed with the bat in Alur.

Have CSK locked in a BBL star for death bowling? R Ashwin thinks so IPL 2026: Chennai Super Kings will rely heavily on Nathan Ellis for their death bowling in the upcoming season, former spinner R Ashwin has predicted. After releasing Matheesha Pathirana, CSK did not buy death-overs specialists in the auction earlier this month in Abu Dhabi.

Shan Masood eclipses Inzamam-ul-Haq with fastest first-class 200 by Pakistan batter Shan Masood sets a new benchmark in Pakistani first-class cricket, achieving a double century in just 177 balls while leading Sui Northern Gas in the President's Cup.

Ashes: Jacob Bethell admits he has more to do to stay England's No.3 in Tests Ashes: Jacob Bethell has admitted he still has more to do to cement England's number three spot in Test cricket, despite playing a key role in the Boxing Day victory in Melbourne.

PM Modi congratulates Koneru Humpy, Arjun Erigaisi after World Rapid bronze medals Prime Minister Narendra Modi has publicly lauded the achievements of Koneru Humpy and Arjun Erigaisi following their bronze medal wins at the FIDE World Rapid Chess Championships in Doha.

Why did Koneru Humpy miss tiebreakers despite being tied for top spot? Koneru Humpy was in with a chance to win the World Rapid title heading into the final round, but a botched Bishop move and the complicated Busscholtz tiebreaker system ensured that the Indian Grandmaster could not win the World Rapid title.

Will Angkrish keep wickets for KKR? Youngster upskills in Vijay HazareVijay Hazare Trophy: Mumbai opener Angkrish Raghuvanshi has been upskilling his wicketkeeping in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Is Angkrish preparing to keep wickets for KKR in IPL 2026?

Ashes: Greg Chappell slams batters after MCG debacle, warns Test cricket is doomedGreg Chappell has slammed modern Ashes batters for lacking patience and application, warning that Test cricket's future is at risk if players cannot adapt and bat for long periods.

Lamine Yamal brushes aside Ronaldo comparisons: I want to build my own pathLamine Yamal said he wants to carve out his own identity in football, playing down comparisons with Cristiano Ronaldo after winning the Best Forward award at the Globe Soccer Awards. The 18-year-old Barcelona and Spain forward reflected on his rapid rise and reiterated his focus on building a career on his own terms.

Who's Sonam Yeshey? Bhutan bowler who scripted T20 history with 8-wicket haulBhutan's Sonam Yeshey scripted history, becoming the first player to claim eight wickets in a T20 match. He finished with match figures of 8/7 in four overs to help Bhutan beat Myanmar by 8 wickets.

Hypocrisy over MCG pitch? Ex-India batter targets English, Australian mediaAshes: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has slammed the English and Australian media for what he called double standards in the way pitches in their own countries are judged compared to those in India. The Boxing Day Test at the MCG ended in less than two days, sparking debate among fans worldwide. Chopra posed a simple question: had a Test match in India finished inside two days, would the reaction have been the same?

Virat Kohli to return for Vijay Hazare Trophy on January 6 ahead of New Zealand ODIsVirat Kohli is set to return for a third game in the Vijay Hazare Trophy for Delhi. India Today has learnt that he will be a part of the squad that takes on Railways on January 6.

Ashes: ICC gives Melbourne pitch for Boxing Day Test second-worst ratingThe Melbourne Cricket Ground pitch used for the fourth Ashes Test has received an "Unsatisfactory" rating, resulting in one demerit point for the venue under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process.

Dhruv Jurel slams 101-ball 160 in Vijay Hazare Trophy ahead of New Zealand ODIsDhruv Jurel smashed an unbeaten 160* off 101 balls to help Uttar Pradesh score 369 against Baroda in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. It was the third successive fifty-plus score for the youngster in the tournament.

Mitchell Starc backed to defy history, play Ashes and World Cup in 2027Mitchell Starc's durability is reshaping expectations around fast-bowling longevity. With another dominant Ashes summer behind him, Australia believe the left-armer could still be leading attacks at the 2027 Ashes and World Cup.

Shubman Gill can't be an all-format captain: Ex-cricketer slams Kohli comparisonsFormer England spinner Monty Panesar has dismissed Shubman Gill as an all-format captain, saying the young batter does not yet possess the intensity required for the role.

Someone wants to marry my husband: Pakistan cricketer's wife explains divorceSannia Ashfaq has revealed the reason for her divorce from former Pakistan cricketer Imad Wasim, citing third-party involvement. Imad and Sannia were married in August 2019 in Islamabad.

T20 World Cup 2026: Australia set to make key Pat Cummins call despite injuryAustralia remain confident Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David will be fit for the T20 World Cup. Despite injury concerns, selectors are set to include the trio in their provisional squad.

IND vs NZ: Special tickets for students, specially-abled fans in Indore ODITickets for the India-New Zealand final ODI, scheduled to be played in Indore on January 18, will be sold exclusively online. The Madhay Pradesh Cricket Assocition has announced special concessions for students and specially-abled fans, enhancing accessibility.

Joe Root backs Brendon McCullum, Ben Stokes to continue despite Ashes lossJoe Root has expressed strong support for Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum-led team management despite England's Ashes series loss in Australia. England are trailing by 1-3 in the ongoing series with one match remaining.

ISL future in flux as Odisha FC weigh exit, Jamshedpur commit to revised seasonThe Indian Super League faces fresh uncertainty as clubs debate costs and format. Jamshedpur FC have committed to the revised season, while Odisha FC may opt out unless financial clarity and commercial backing emerge.

Sunil Gavaskar questions ICC's double standards: MCG pitch will be rated 'good'Sunil Gavaskar has criticised the ICC for double standards in awarding pitch ratings after the Melbourne Test ended in two days. A total of 36 wickets fell within two days as the entire Test match was completed within 142 overs.

Gus Atkinson ruled out of Sydney Test, England to not name any replacementEngland fast bowler Gus Atkinson has been ruled out of the final Ashes Test in Sydney after sustaining a hamstring injury. The fifth Ashes Test is set to be played in Sydney beginning on January 4.

Ashes: Australia selectors to decide Khawaja Test future as no retirement word yetUsman Khawaja's Test future remains uncertain despite growing retirement speculation. With no word yet from the veteran batter, Australian selectors are prepared to independently assess his place beyond the Sydney Ashes Test.

John Cena's farewell chaos, a Rocky dilemma: Why 2025 wasn't WWE's finest yearA year that was supposed to be a brilliant one for WWE ended being one of the frustrating ones from a creative standpoint. The company fumbled John Cena's farewell run and the absence of the Rock and the return of Brock Lesnar failed to inspire a revival for them in 2025.

Cristiano Ronaldo sets 1000-goals target clear: I will reach that number for sureCristiano Ronaldo has set his sights firmly on football's unreachable 1000-goal milestone. Fresh from Globe Soccer Awards recognition, the Al-Nassr star insists injuries aside, his scoring journey is far from finished.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
